theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage by ROS, mitochondrial dysfunction, and proteostasis collapse as primary aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative damage from mitochondrial superoxide radicals and role of antioxidant enzymes in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS-generated oxidative stress from mitochondria causing DNA, protein, and lipid damage leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stochastic oxidative damage by reactive oxygen intermediates from metabolism as primary aging driver.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress, mitochondrial DNA deletions, and oxidative damage accumulation as aging causes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Considers oxidative stress and molecular damage accumulation as major contributors to aging phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as major damage source and links damage control efficiency to lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage by ROS and its accumulation as causal for aging and lifespan modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Asymmetric Segregation in Unicellular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of molecular damage and asymmetric damage segregation during unicellular organism division.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Asymmetric Segregation in Unicellular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models damage accumulation, repair, and dilution by cell division affecting clonal senescence and fitness.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Asymmetric Segregation in Unicellular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on damaged protein accumulation and asymmetric retention in mother cells driving replicative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Asymmetric Segregation in Unicellular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details asymmetric segregation of damaged molecules and ERC accumulation in yeast replicative aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Asymmetric Segregation in Unicellular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes damage accumulation and asymmetric segregation in bacteria leading to senescence and population dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Asymmetric Segregation in Unicellular Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains asymmetric damage partitioning during cell division enabling rejuvenation and cellular immortality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models senescence as progressive physiological damage accumulation with thresholds triggering mortality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes feedback-accelerated damage accumulation and stochastic mortality when damage surpasses thresholds.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights positive feedback loops in damage accumulation and threshold effects limiting lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on unrepaired genomic damage accumulation increasing vulnerability and triggering phenoptosis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes stochastic molecular fidelity loss and early onset of damage leading to aging and disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates genetic, environmental, epigenetic, and stochastic damage accumulation as drivers of aging phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stochastic Damage Threshold and Mortality Models
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of molecular damage exceeding thresholds and potential interventions via repair.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair and Proteostasis Decline in Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage accumulation, repair efficiency, and proteostasis decline as key aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair and Proteostasis Decline in Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights somatic repair gene expression differences modulating lifespan via DNA and protein maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair and Proteostasis Decline in Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details enhanced DNA repair, tumor suppressor gene duplication, and genomic stability in long-lived whales.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Repair and Proteostasis Decline in Accumulated Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes limits of repair mechanisms and progressive macromolecular damage accumulation causing aging.
